[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, nested sentence structures (e.g., "The reign of Queen Victoria... covered the latter half of this saeculum mirabile...")
[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary ("saeculum mirabile," "reaping our past") may disrupt flow for modern readers

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between historical examples (e.g., shift from Roman Empire to Industrial Revolution)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of explicit connectors between paragraphs (e.g., "But there can be no question..." feels disconnected)
[CLARITY]: Overloaded paragraphs with unrelated ideas (e.g., Victorian social order + demographic statistics)

[LEXICON]: Inconsistent/inaccurate terminology ("the stuff" instead of a specific entity).
[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "It had the double effect...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between topics (e.g., working-class conditions to economic analyses).
[STRUCTURE]: Lack of logical flow between paragraphs (e.g., poverty discussion to progress narrative).
